food.mechanism: Remove import quotas and tariffs on food products

telecom.mechanism: Already achieved via 2012 deregulation — proof that competition works

economicPrinciples.author: Milton Friedman
economicPrinciples.principle: Nobody spends somebody else's money as carefully as he spends his own.
economicPrinciples.application: Government spending inherently lacks the feedback mechanism of personal spending. When bureaucrats allocate your tax shekels, they have no personal stake in the outcome.

economicPrinciples.author: Milton Friedman
economicPrinciples.principle: The most important single central fact about a free market is that no exchange takes place unless both parties benefit.
economicPrinciples.application: When telecom was deregulated in Israel in 2012, prices dropped 80%. Proof that competition delivers better outcomes than government-managed markets.

economicPrinciples.author: Friedrich Hayek
economicPrinciples.principle: The curious task of economics is to demonstrate to men how little they really know about what they imagine they can design.
economicPrinciples.application: Central planning of housing, food prices, and wages always produces worse outcomes than market coordination. Israel's housing crisis is a direct result of government land control.

economicPrinciples.author: Milton Friedman
economicPrinciples.principle: A society that puts equality before freedom will get neither. A society that puts freedom before equality will get a high degree of both.
economicPrinciples.application: Economic freedom enables prosperity for all — not just the connected few. Countries with higher economic freedom consistently show higher standards of living.

economicPrinciples.author: Milton Friedman
economicPrinciples.principle: Nothing is so permanent as a temporary government program.
economicPrinciples.application: Israel's bureaucracy has grown steadily while service quality stagnates. Programs never die, they only grow — each one adding overhead that taxpayers bear.
